snippet: A note left by the man, 77, who killed himself in a busy Athens square, said that he could not bear the prospect of scavenging for food, the local news media said.
abstract: Greek pensioner distraught over his financial state shoots himself in the head in busy main square in Athens near Parliament, shouting 'I don’t want to leave debts to my children,' before pulling the trigger.
lead_paragraph: A note left by the man, 77, who killed himself in a busy Athens square, said that he could not bear the prospect of scavenging for food, the local news media said.

headline.seo: Public Suicide for Greek Man With Fiscal Woe
headline.main: Public Suicide for Greek Man With Fiscal Woe
headline.print_headline: Public Suicide For Greek Man With Fiscal Woe
